PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| ladder-type polymers |
| forced planarity |
| device performance |
| PCEs |
| bandgap |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| bandgap |

The following entities do not clearly refer to material properties and were removed:

* "ladder-type polymers" (this refers to the structure or shape of the material, not a specific property)
* "forced planarity" (this refers to the synthesis method or processing technique, not a specific property)
* "device performance" (this refers to the performance of a device made from the material, not a specific property of the material itself)
* "PCEs" (this is an abbreviation for "power conversion efficiency," which is a property of a device, not a material property)

Note: "ca." is an abbreviation for "circa" which means "approximately" or "around". It is commonly used to indicate a rough estimate or a range of values rather than a precise value.
